sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": "
 
What number should be subtracted from each of the numbers \(9 \), \(15 \), and \(22 \) to make the reminders be in continued proportion.
\newline

", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 1, "step_txt": "$$\text{Lets suppose that the required number is $z $.

Since the numbers $9 - z $, $\input[s1v1]{} - z $, $22 - z $, are in proportion, we have}$$
\[
	\frac{9 - z }{15 - z } = \frac{15 - z }{22 - z }
\]"}, {"id": "s2", "n_params": 1, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow (\input[s2v1]{} - z )(22 - z ) = (15 - z )(15 - z )
\]"}, {"id": "s3", "n_params": 1, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow \input[s3v1]{} - z (31 ) + z ^2 = 225 - z (30 ) + z ^2
\]"}, {"id": "s4", "n_params": 1, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow z(\input[s4v1]{} - 31 ) = 225 - 198 
\]"}, {"id": "s5", "n_params": 1, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow z = \frac{\input[s5v1]{} - 198 }{30 - 31 }
\]"}, {"id": "s6", "n_params": 1, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow z = \frac{\input[s6v1]{} }{-1 }
\]"}, {"id": "s7", "n_params": 1, "step_txt": "
\[
	\Rightarrow z = \frac{\input[s7v1]{} }{1 }
\]"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": [15], "text": "$$\text{Suppose the required number that needs to be subtracted from each given number is z. Then, the new set of numbers would be $9 - z $, $15 - z $, $22 - z $,. Since these numbers are in continued proportion, we can write:$\frac{9 - z }{15 - z } = \frac{15 - z }{22 - z }$}$$ "}, {"data": [9], "text": "$$\text{ Cross-multiplying the above equation, we get: $ (9 - z )(22 - z ) = (15 - z )(15 - z ) $}$$"}, {"data": [198], "text": "$$\text{Expanding the above equation, we get: $ 198 - z (31 ) + z ^2 = 225 - z (30 ) + z ^2$}$$ "}, {"data": [30], "text": "$$\text{ Bringing all the common terms on one side, we get: $z (30 - 31 ) = 225 - 198$}$$"}, {"data": [225], "text": "$$\text{Further simplification will get us this equation $z = \frac{225 - 198 }{30 - 31 }$}$$ "}, {"data": [27], "text": "$$\text{Upon further arithmetic calculation, we achieve this: $z = \frac{27 }{-1 }$}$$ "}, {"data": [-27], "text": "$$\text{Our final result would be $z = \frac{-27 }{1 }$}$$ "}]
